problem: If 4 daps are equivalent to 3 dops, and 2 dops are equivalent to 7 dips, how many daps are equivalent to 42 dips?
solution: First, 4 daps are equivalent to 3 dops: $$\frac{4 \mbox{ daps}}{3 \mbox{ dops}} = 1$$ Second, 2 dops are equivalent to 7 dips: $$ \frac{2 \mbox{ dops}}{7 \mbox{ dips}} = 1$$ Hence, 8 daps are equivalent to 21 dips: $$ \frac{4 \mbox{ daps}}{3 \mbox{ dops}}\cdot \frac{2 \mbox{ dops}}{7 \mbox{ dips}} = \frac{8 \mbox{ daps}}{21 \mbox{ dips}} = 1$$ Conveniently, $42$ dips is exactly twice $21$ dips. So, $\boxed{16\text{ daps}}$ are equivalent to $42$ dips.
